bernadette-fong.name: Bernadette Fong
bernadette-fong.writeup:
Hi! I'm Bernadette and I completed my undergraduate in Mechanical Engineering with a Robotics specialisation and a minor in Life Sciences. I'm currently studying Financial Engineering at the Risk Management Institute.

I like learning and took as many interesting as courses I could handle, including convex optimisation, business law, and business econometrics. Beyond that, I've also completed the Associate Data Scientist in Python pathway on DataCamp and the Foundations in AI course by AISG.

My internship and final year project has let me explore some of the areas where Life Science and Engineering intersect, two of the things that have fascinated me for a long time.

Outside of academics, I love hiking and travelling, gymnastics/calisthenics, and rock climbing/bouldering. Some mountains I've summmitted include Scout Peak (5710m) in the Himalayas, Mytikas Peak of Mount Olympus (2918m), and Mount Rinjani in Lombok (3726m).

However, my personal mountain to climb is finding in a career that gives me such a strong sense of purpose that I would want to continue in it even when I feel secure in my finances.

ian-ng.name: Ian Ng
ian-ng.writeup:
Hello! My name is Ian and I am a graduate student pursuing a MSc in Data Science. Previously, I majored in Computer Engineering for my undergraduate degree. I have enjoyed my time in E-Scholars very much and am thankful for the friends I have made along the way.

I am a strong believer in the pay-it-forward culture and will gladly offer my advice/mentorship to any junior regardless of major. Feel free to drop me a message if you require any help from me, and I will be more than happy to assist you in any way I can!

ryan-sui.name: Ryan Sui
ryan-sui.writeup: Hi everyone, I am Ryan Sui, a Y4 E-Scholar having completed my undergraduate studies in Materials Science in Engineering (MSE) and am currently enrolled in the Masters in Business Analytics (MSBA) programme in NUS. My academic interests involved attempting to apply data-driven analytical techniques to different areas of material science such as cheminformatics. Feel free to reach out and ask any questions you may have, academic or otherwise, regarding the programme and student life at NUS in general. See you guys around!
ryan-sui.notable_achievements: Surviving e-scholars (barely; remains to be truly seen).

alyxia-seah.name: Alyxia Seah
alyxia-seah.writeup:
Hi! I'm Alyxia, and I'm a Year 3 student majoring in Biomedical Engineering and Mathematics. I'm passionate about using math and computation to solve problems in biochemistry and biology, and I intend to work in mathematical or scientific research after graduation. Some of my academic interests include applied math and computational biology, specifically protein folding!

In my free time, I love solving and creating all kinds of puzzles. I participate in puzzle hunts regularly and I'm also part of Solve@NUS, an NUS interest group for avid puzzlers. If you enjoy solving any kinds of mind-bending puzzles, like word puzzles, logic puzzles, and more, please join us!

Feel free to reach out to me if you'd like to chat about anything!
alyxia-seah.notable_achievements:
Biomedical Engineering Achievement Award (2023)
Champions in League of Legends Inter-College Games (2023)

claire-lam.name: Claire Lam
claire-lam.writeup:
Hi! My name is Claire and I am a Year 3 undergraduate majoring in Biomedical Engineering, with a specialization in Biomedical Materials and a Minor in Public Health.
A personal motto that I try to live by is ‚ÄúNot to make a living for myself, but to make living better for others.‚Äù This is one of the reasons I chose to major in Engineering, specifically Biomedical Engineering, as I aspire to innovate to improve lives.
The e-scholar community has been so supportive, fun and uplifting and I'm incredibly thankful for the friendships I've forged here so far! I'm definitely looking forward to the future memories we'll make together! üòÅ
claire-lam.notable_achievements:
Vice Captain, ACSI Cross Country A‚ÄôDivision 20/21,
Interaction Committee for Connecting MINDS (student-initiated project supporting the Movement for the Intellectually Disabled of Singapore) (2020),
Events Director (Welfare), E-Scholars Student Committee AY22/23
claire-lam.interests_hobbies:
Outdoor activities like hiking/running/just walks
Watching kdramas and animes
I love finding new music and going karaoke!

kenneth-goh.name: Kenneth Goh
kenneth-goh.writeup:
Hello everyone! My name is Kenneth, a year 3 Biomedical Engineering student with a specialization in Tissue Engineering, and a Minor in Life Science.

When I am free, you will see me at RC4 Squash and Spikeball IG sessions normally or just random sports IG.

Reach out to me if you have any questions, or would just like to have someone to talk to :D

ng-yu-fei.name: Ng Yu Fei
ng-yu-fei.writeup:
Hi! My name is Yu Fei and I'm an E-scholar majoring in Biomedical Engineering with a minor in Life Sciences. Despite not taking physics in A-levels, my keen passion in Biology and Design encouraged me to explore the field of Engineering.

In my past industry experience, I had the privilege of being involved in the design and processing of 3D prints using CAD software. I primarily worked with SLA technology (Formlabs, Asiga), with brief experience handling SLS and FDM prints as well. I was also fortunate enough to be offered a role as a Global Markets Intern, where I got to expose myself to the market dynamics while working on the trading floor.

In my free time, I enjoy gaming and taking naps. I especially enjoy playing sports or just being outdoors in general. Outside of E-scholars and RC4, I am also involved in Chinese Orchestra and Muay Thai CCAs.

I am constantly seeking for new opportunities to learn and gain new insights from others, or to share some experiences of my own. If you are considering pursuing Engineering without a Physics background, or have an interest in macrobiology/ enotomology, feel free to connect with me :-)
ng-yu-fei.interests_hobbies:
Sports
Nature & Hiking
Looking at ants

clive-choong.name: Clive Choong
clive-choong.writeup:
Hi everyone! I'm a final year undergraduate studying Biomedical Engineering with a minor in Public Health. I'm extremely passionate about healthcare and medical technology, and I've worked on projects and internships in the areas of Biorobotics, Biomaterials, Rehabilitation Medicine, Bioinstrumentation and Mental Health. During my  semester abroad at Johns Hopkins, I completed ‚ÄúIdentity Formation for Future Healthcare Professionals‚Äù under Dr Margaret Chisolm, learning about the foundation required to thrive as a physician and I am currently reading a Pre-Med class at Duke NUS headed by Dr Wong Peiyan.

Outside of school, I volunteer as a research consultant for the Ministry of Education to train secondary and JC students for the International Science and Engineering Fair and the Singapore Science and Engineering Fair. During my free time, I go cycling in the evenings after school and bake on the weekends!

Feel free to reach out if you have any similar interests or would just like to connect :)

karishma-thirumaran.name: Karishma Thirumaran
karishma-thirumaran.writeup:
Hi, I‚Äôm Karishma! I‚Äôm a Y3 undergraduate majoring in Computer Engineering.

Currently, I am interested in innovation in software engineering, and exploring the diverse opportunities in the sector such as automation, app development and AI. I am also passionate about business and entrepreneurship, and was part of the Jan'24 NOC Munich batch.

Other than watching bad hallmark christmas movies, my personal interests include playing the drums and english literature. Feel free to connect with me to discuss about anything from cs to seasonal movies!

yeo-meng-han.name: Yeo Meng Han
yeo-meng-han.writeup: Hi! I'm an undergraduate at the National University of Singapore (NUS) studying computer engineering under the Engineering Scholars (E-Scholars) Programme. I'm very passionate about entrepreneurship and developments in the field of technology and innovation - specifically the forefront of Robotics, Computer Vision and AI. At the moment, I'm deeply interested in manifesting the power of LLM via AI Agents and Retrieval-Augmented-Generation (RAG).
yeo-meng-han.notable_achievements:
NUS Computing Lifehack Project Director 2023
AI Singapore National AI Challenge Track 3 Top 3 Winner
NOC Alumni (NOC Vietnam AY23/24 Semester 2)
yeo-meng-han.interests_hobbies:
Watching documentaries
Strategy Computer Games
Manga / Korean manhwa!

ryan-tan.name: Ryan Tan
ryan-tan.writeup: Hi, I'm Ryan, majoring in Computer Engineering. I am interested in software development and exploring AI/ML tools. Aside from academics, I also like playing table tennis and long distance running.
ryan-tan.interests_hobbies:
Long distance running
Table Tennis
Dance

shan-yu-xuan.name: Shan Yu Xuan
shan-yu-xuan.writeup: Hi! I am Yu Xuan, I had a lot of fun during my NUS journey, going to winter school, exchange, overseas trips and more. I will be going to Silicon Valley for internship soon.

man-juncheng.name: Man Juncheng
man-juncheng.writeup: Hey there! I'm Juncheng, a final year Computer Engineering undergraduate under the E-Scholars Programme. Throughout my undergraduate journey, I have gained experience in the fields of robotics, FPGA, embedded systems, networking, AI/ML, microelectronics, and software engineering. My current interests lie in embedded systems, AI/ML, and quantum computing, and I intend to pursue further studies in quantum computing hardware to help contribute to developing fault-tolerant qubits and realising universal quantum computing. Hit me up if you would like to discuss more on quantum!
man-juncheng.notable_achievements:
Intel Cup Electronic Design Contest First Prize Winner
AI Singapore National AI Challenge Track 3 Top 3 Winner
Undergraduate Teaching Assistant (CG1111A, CG2111A)
man-juncheng.interests_hobbies:
Technical Fishing
Fine Arts & Illustration
Hiking

zhuo-jiaying.name: Zhuo Jiaying
zhuo-jiaying.writeup: Hi! I'm Zhuo Jiaying, a year 3 chemical engineering student. I took SUSEP in year 2 sem 2 and am doing a specialisation in process engineering! ü•≥

kelvyna-lee.name: Kelvyna Lee
kelvyna-lee.writeup:
Loving. Responsible. Respectful. These are words that people use to describe me. My values are shaped by my Christian faith and by my close-knit family.

I am thankful that I have been awarded the NUS Engineering Scholarship. I have also been offered a conditional admission to the Duke-NUS NUS Engineering and Medicine Track programme.

Currently, I play Lawn Bowls for Team Singapore. This is a sport which requires mental strength and focus to bowl consistently, and the ability to adjust quickly to different in-game scenarios.

I also serve regularly in church through singing and serving on the Audio-Visual team. My passion for missions has led me to Cambodia to bring joy to the less privileged, and I look forward to serving God‚Äôs people wherever I am called to!

goh-ting-en-jonathan.name: Goh Ting En Jonathan
goh-ting-en-jonathan.writeup: Heyoo! I‚Äôm Jonathan, a chemical engineering undergraduate taking a materials minor as well. I‚Äôm very passionate about semiconductors and how engineering can integrate multiple scientific concepts to produce cutting edge technologies that help our everyday lives. On a more personal note, I‚Äôm also a basketball enthusiast for more than a decade, so I‚Äôll likely dribble any ball you pass to me.  :)
goh-ting-en-jonathan.notable_achievements:
SEP (University of Texas at Austin AY2023/2024 Semester 2)
Basketball coaching assistant for alma mater Dunman High School (2023 to present)
goh-ting-en-jonathan.interests_hobbies:
Basketball
Fishing
Nerdy stuff (Star Wars, LOTR, Transformers etc)

ellia-tio.name: Ellia Tio
ellia-tio.writeup: Hello! I‚Äôm Ellia and I‚Äôm a Year 3 Electrical Engineering student. I‚Äôm planning to finish an IOT specialization and a minor in Information Security.

tan-hsien-rong.name: Tan Hsien Rong
tan-hsien-rong.writeup:
Hi there! I‚Äôm Hsien Rong and I am a Year 3 Electrical Engineering undergraduate under the E-Scholars Programme :)

Engineering is my passion. During my pre-university days, my avid participation in robotics competitions and hackathons led me to discover my love for building and designing things. Today, as an electrical engineering undergraduate, I continue to pursue my passion in robotics and programming. I remain captivated by the endless possibilities of what I can create, and am always excited to see my own creations come to life.

Outside of NUS, I've worked with microcontroller programming, IoT, computer vision, signal processing and antenna design during internships with DSO and DSTA. I've also dabbled in app and game programming (Android Studio, Unity Engine, Godot Engine) for my personal projects.

I am excited to be part of the E-Scholars Programme, and I look forward to continue making new friends and learning new things as I enter my final year as an undergrad!

goh-ron-jay.name: Goh Ron-Jay
goh-ron-jay.writeup:
Hi I'm Jay, I study EE (and MSE). I strongly believe in passing it forward so I do a bunch of outreach stuff for escholars and CDE. I went to UIUC for exchange and that was a life-changing experience, highly recommend going for exchange.
Professionally I hope to work in semicon or signal processing, hopefully in the US maybe. Personally, I hope to retire as a tour guide ^_^.
goh-ron-jay.notable_achievements:
Fell asleep at airport gate and watched my plane fly away
completing a 6-day 100km hike + camp along the Australian coast

teo-jia-xin.name: Teo Jia Xin
teo-jia-xin.writeup:
Hello! I'm Jia Xin, a Year 3 student studying Environmental and Sustainability Engineering and Economics (Double Degree Programme) at the National University of Singapore :)

I am really passionate about learning new things, as it makes me realise that there is so much in the world that I can discover more about. Outside of academics, I have had many experiences, ranging from leadership positions, volunteering, to internships in different disciplines.

Through the experiences I have gone through and the skills that I have picked up, my greater goal is to contribute back to the community. In the future, I hope to work in policy or sustainability-related roles, to improve the lives of people through the work that I do, and ensure that Singapore can grow sustainably with inclusivity in mind.

Feel free to connect with me to discuss anything ranging from current affairs, sustainability, economics, or anything out there!
teo-jia-xin.notable_achievements:
Champions of Singapore Undergraduate Policy Conference 2024
Merit Award in Engineering Innovation Challenge 2023
7th to 16th placing in NUS Built Environment Case Competition 2024

ean-cheng.name: Ean Cheng
ean-cheng.writeup: Hi Ean here! A Y3 Material Science Student...idk what I'm supposed to write here HAHA

yim-hau-yin-ethan.name: Yim Hau Yin, Ethan
yim-hau-yin-ethan.writeup:
Hi! I'm Ethan and I major in Mechanical Engineering, with a specialisation in Aeronautical Engineering. I have a keen interest in the aviation industry and aspire to be a pilot after I graduate. In my free time, I enjoy swimming, listening to music and shooting the breeze with my friends.
Feel free to chat with me - I love getting to know new people!
yim-hau-yin-ethan.notable_achievements:
O-Level German
RC4 Swimming IG Captain
Outstanding Student Award

matthew-yip.name: Matthew Yip
matthew-yip.writeup: Hello! I am Matthew Yip, a final-year Mechanical Engineering student with a Second Major in Computer Science. I have a deep passion for both engineering and tech, and this reflects in my hobbies that include 3D printing and coding with Raspberry Pis!

xue-tingkai.name: Xue Tingkai
xue-tingkai.writeup: Did first internship related to mechanical design and realized it's not my cup of tea. Doing physics-informed machine learning now.

isaac-poh-wen-kang.name: Isaac Poh Wen Kang
isaac-poh-wen-kang.writeup: I'm Isaac, Y3 in Mechanical Engineering, with a passion for the Aerospace engineering and playing music.

lim-heng-wee-ivan.name: Lim Heng Wee Ivan
lim-heng-wee-ivan.writeup: I'm part of the E-scholars Programme and an aspiring aerospace engineer. I'm passionate about making a difference in the aerospace industry. I am deeply interested in the field of biomimicry in flight mechanics.
lim-heng-wee-ivan.interests_hobbies:
Reading both non-fiction books on technology and fiction novels
Snowboarding

amelia-ong.name: Amelia Ong
amelia-ong.writeup: Hi, I‚Äôm Amelia! I‚Äôm passionate about MedTech and love exploring new innovations in the field. I‚Äôm a bubbly person who‚Äôs always up for a chat, so feel free to approach me anytime!

savannah-chan.name: Savannah Chan
savannah-chan.writeup: i do muay thai & music in my free time :-)

ryan-leong.name: Ryan Leong
ryan-leong.writeup:
Hi I‚Äôm Ryan Leong and I am a Y3 Computer Engineering student under the E-Scholars program staying in RC4. I will be going for NOC SV in the year of 2025 :)

Outside of academics, I am interested in playing guitar and performing, I am a member of RC4ME and planning to join NUS Amplified. Additionally, I like exercising and playing sports like football.

bryan-loh.name: Bryan Loh
bryan-loh.writeup: Hi! I‚Äôm Bryan, a Y3 undergraduate majoring in Chemical Engineering.

nga-jing-wen.name: Nga Jing Wen
nga-jing-wen.writeup: hi, i spend a lot of time coiling audio cables and doing math!

lock-de-ying-ethan.name: Lock De Ying Ethan
lock-de-ying-ethan.writeup:
Hi, I am Ethan Lock, a Y3 Mechanical Engineering student in the Engineering Scholars Programme.

I enjoy having a wide range of hobbies. I picked up fishing in secondary school, and have been doing so for the past 10 years. I also enjoy tinkering with electronics and have built my own computer.

Feel free to talk to me about anything :D

gerianne-lee-shyi-chee.name: Gerianne Lee Shyi Chee
gerianne-lee-shyi-chee.writeup:
Hello! My name is Gerianne Lee and I am a Y3 Mechanical Engineering student (with a specialisation in Energy and Sustainability and a minor in Geosciences)

I am always looking to explore new opportunities and meet new people, so feel free to connect with me anytime! :p

nicholas-chia-yik-kiat.name: Nicholas Chia Yik Kiat
nicholas-chia-yik-kiat.writeup: Hello! I am a Year 2 Mechanical Engineering student (as of AY24/25) under the Engineering Scholars (E-Scholars) Programme. I have a burning passion for anything aviation and so I went to Purdue University for my Student Exchange Programme (SEP). In my free time, I play Hoyoverse games and volunteer to feed the campus cats!
nicholas-chia-yik-kiat.notable_achievements: (SEP) Purdue University - Deans List, Semester Honors

janelle-tang.name: Janelle Tang
janelle-tang.writeup:
Hello! I am Janelle, a Year 2 student majoring in Biomedical Engineering under the Engineering Scholars Programme at NUS.

While I am particularly interested in the area of research and tissue engineering, I am open to exploring other areas of specialisation and I hope to find something that I will enjoy doing in the future.

I am grateful for this opportunity and I hope that this experience will help me grow both academically and as a person!

tan-xin-yi.name: Tan Xin Yi
tan-xin-yi.writeup:
Hello, I am Xin Yi, an undergraduate student majoring in Biomedical Engineering.  I am particularly interested in the manufacturing and innovation of biomedical devices. This encourages me to specialize in biomedical materials. It fascinates me  how engineers can invent new machines to reduce patients' discomfort, or provide alternatives to invasive surgical methods. After graduation, I aspire to contribute to society through my work in engineering. As such, I am grateful for the many opportunities provided by the E-Scholar community and look forward to the next few years of my academic journey.

Aside from my academics, I also find solace in reading. I love the feeling of being transported into starkly different situations and experiencing them from a new perspective. Often, you can find me hunched over and immersed in a book. I also enjoy spending time with my family and friends, whether it's cycling at East Coast Park or huddling together over a game of Mahjong.
tan-xin-yi.notable_achievements:
Vice-President of AVA Club
Best Improvement Award in J1 Promotional Examination
Honour Roll for JC2 Common Test

celeste-tan.name: Celeste Tan
celeste-tan.writeup:
Hi! I'm Celeste Tan and I'm studying Computer Engineering under the E-Scholars (Engineering Scholars) Programme. I plan to take two specialisations and then go on to take my masters in NUS, but as of now am still undecided. I am also aiming to join Bumblebee in NUS.

I do prefer the software side of computer engineering slightly more than the electrical side, but I do appreciate a healthy mix of both best, as I find that it excites me and pushes me to keep learning the most.

Feel free to contact me if you have any questions or just want to connect!
celeste-tan.notable_achievements: Past Tech Lead of VIAWiki (www.viawiki.org), building the website in Next.js from ground up to completion

jordan-tan.name: Jordan Tan
jordan-tan.writeup:
Hi! My name is Jordan and I'm a Year 2 Computer Engineering student.

I hope to enhance my coding and design skills through projects, internships and overseas attachments. I'm interested to explore more about artificial intelligence, robotics and other programming languages. As someone with a keen interest in aviation, I am excited to see how I can apply what I have learnt to make air travel safer and more efficient.

I really enjoy travelling, learning about new places and cultures, and exploring different cuisines. But chicken rice will always have a special place in my heart!

kenneth-gao.name: Kenneth Gao
kenneth-gao.writeup: hi i'm kenneth and i like dogs

rayan-wong.name: Rayan Wong
rayan-wong.writeup:
Hello, my name is Rayan Wong and I am a Y2 Computer Engineering Student staying in RC4.

I'm currently looking to become a software developer (inclined to web development but also open to other branches).

ryan-ng.name: Ryan Ng
ryan-ng.writeup:
Hi I am Ryan, a Y2 CEG student looking into studying a specialisation (haven't decided on one yet). However, I do know that I am passionate in both hardware and software and bridging the two together.

Outside of NUS, I am interested in a multitude of activities so feel free to reach out to me for anything!

sanjay-kumar.name: Sanjay Kumar
sanjay-kumar.writeup: Hello! I am Sanjay, a Computer Engineering major. I am passionate about science and engineering and I love acquiring new knowledge. I also love music and play the guitar!

heng-teng-yi.name: Heng Teng Yi
heng-teng-yi.writeup:
Hi! I am Teng Yi, a Y2 Computer Engineering student under the E-Scholars Programme. I enjoy designing, fabricating, wiring and programming robots (and other electronics projects).

I got my start with electronics building autonomous soccer robots for RoboCup Junior in 2019, and I've been eager to learn more about electronics design ever since.

In NUS, I'm hoping to delve more into integrated circuit design, processor design and low-level firmware programming; the area where hardware and software intersect is where I believe I work best.

Outside of class, I maintain software libraries and design circuit boards and casings for my educational robotics product line EVN. Apart from that, I intend to join the Bumblebee CCA to continue honing my electrical engineering and system integration skills.

In my free time, I like playing Ultimate Frisbee and spending time with my cats (they're very cute).
heng-teng-yi.notable_achievements:
Technical Lead (& Co-Creator) of EVN Alpha, a robot controller for education & competition
Best Technical Challenges (RCJ Soccer Open League, RoboCup 2021 Worldwide)
1st Place Overall Champion (RCJ Rescue Line U19, RoboCup Asia Pacific 2022)
heng-teng-yi.interests_hobbies:
Building Gundam model kits
Ultimate Frisbee
3D Printing

lim-zerui.name: Lim Zerui
lim-zerui.writeup:
Hey guys i‚Äôm Zerui, a Year 2 Computer Engineering student.

I‚Äôm interested in software engineering and hope to participate actively in various hackathons and hands on experiences like NOC.

tan-zheng-jie.name: Tan Zheng Jie
tan-zheng-jie.writeup:
Hello! My name is Tan Zheng Jie, and I am a first-year Computer Engineering student with a second major in Management under the Engineering Scholars Program.

I am passionate about leveraging research and engineering to make a positive impact on society. My primary interests in engineering lie in networking and robotics. I hope to participate in a student exchange program somewhere in Europe to experience studying overseas and gain new perspectives. Feel free to connect with me to discuss anything!

gwyneth-tan.name: Gweneth Tan
gwyneth-tan.writeup:
Naturally inquisitive, I enjoy learning about topics that I chance up as well as delve deeper in topics that I have already learnt about, especially on biological topics that interest me.
I enjoy challenging myself even outside of academia, for instance deciding to engage in activities that seem daunting when I am travelling or simply because I was given the opportunity to do so.
gwyneth-tan.notable_achievements:
Honorary Mention in Singapore Math Olympiad
High distinction and distinction in Big Science Competition

ashlee-chang.name: Ashlee Chang
ashlee-chang.writeup: Hi! My name is Ashlee and I‚Äôm majoring in Electrical Engineering. I‚Äôm passionate about Robotics and participated in competitions like Robocup and WRO for since P6! I hope to learn more about robotics and electronics in NUS and look forward to my time here :D

then-chin-kiat.name: Then Chin Kiat
then-chin-kiat.writeup:
Hi, I‚Äôm Chin Kiat, a first year freshie and will be studying Electrical Engineering.

I‚Äôm interested in electronic devices and have interest in consumer audio equipment such as headphones, in-ear monitors, dacs, etc. I‚Äôm also an avid enjoyer of Japanese music, anime and manga.

I‚Äôm glad and humbled to be part of the E-scholars programme and plan to make full use of my time here.

grace-lau.name: Grace Lau
grace-lau.writeup:
Hi! I'm Grace, an Electrical Engineering major at NUS CDE! In my 4 years at NUS, I'm excited to learn how to apply my theoretical knowledge to ideate solutions to real life problems, which I hope to achieve by taking the 2nd major in iDP.

I look forward to making full use of the valuable opportunities in NUS to deepen my theoretical knowledge.

Feel free to contact me regarding any enquiries or project ideas!

yap-han.name: Yap Han
yap-han.writeup: Hello! I am Yap Han, an Electrical Engineering Student under the E-Scholars Programme. I am aiming for a career involving sustainable technologies, in particular, clean power generation and its implementation in Singapore.

yap-jit-en-faith.name: Yap Jit En Faith
yap-jit-en-faith.writeup: Hi, I‚Äôm Faith and I‚Äôm a Y2 student studying Electrical Engineering. I‚Äôm interested in learning more about electromagnetism and its applications. Fun fact I was considering a double major in Psychology (decided against). Looking forward to my time here at NUS!

zheng-weilin.name: Zheng Weilin
zheng-weilin.writeup: Hi I'm Weilin! A fun fact about me is that I prefer popsicles to ice cream conesü•π and my pet peeve is the smell of smokingüò¨. I‚Äôm very interested in the bonding and welfare committee because I really want E-scholars to have more opportunities to bond with one another on a regular basis!! This builds a support system that E-scholars can rely on, especially since we are all majoring in engineering, and so we can relate with one another better and understand each other‚Äôs stress and concerns( for eg on a common engineering course). Being more familiar with one another also prevents E-scholars from feeling paiseh in seeking help from other E-scholars. üòÇ Also, I understand that most E-scholars stay in RC4. For me, I stay in nusc but the friends I have made from the E-scholars orientation stay in RC4 so I‚Äôm really sad that there‚Äôs little opportunities for me to interact with them :(( Hence, I really want to join the welfare committee to help organise bonding events so that E-scholars can have many opportunities to bond with one another!! :))) Apart from this reason, I also want to be involved in preparing welfare packs so that I can help E-scholars feel less stressed and more encouraged during exam period. All in all, the first few friends I have made in NUS are from the community of E-scholars so I really feel strongly for giving back and contributing to the welfare of E-scholars. :))
zheng-weilin.notable_achievements:
When I was in junior college, I was a subject representative in class. I helped to gather feedback from my classmates ( for example, did they find the mode of teaching by our teacher effective/ did they find the homework given by our teacher too easy) and shared them with my teacher. I also helped to organise a class gathering whereby my class and our teacher came together to catch up and have fun.:)

While I was in my CCA- chinese orchestra (CO), I volunteered to be an orientation group leader during a musical exchange between my junior college‚Äôs CO and 2 other schools‚Äô CO. I helped to organise ice breaker games to facilitate bonding among students from different schools in my group. At the end of the day, I was glad that the students in my group got to know one another better and had fun playing the games together. :D
zheng-weilin.interests_hobbies: I enjoy spending time with my friends, catching up on each other‚Äôs lives and understanding their current thoughts. Sometimes, I enjoy folding origami (eg hearts) according to YouTube videos and giving them to people I know :))) because I enjoy making them happy! Other times, I enjoy swimming/ jogging in a park.

lin-hong-yi.name: Lin Hong Yi
lin-hong-yi.writeup:
HHI! My name is Lin Hong Yi, and I am a Engineering Science student under the Engineering Scholars Programme. I am currently living in Residential College 4! I am a Tennis addict and train regularly =). I also have side hustles in other sports such as Floorball and Volleyball!!! Hit me up for a sesh anytime, I'm sure they'll be time.

Academically, I am also pursing a second major in iDP as I love problem solving and design! I hope to secure a Semestral SEP in the upcomming academic year as well as a year long NOC after! At the same time I'm also exploring opportunities in Robotics as well as med-tech.

amberly-pock-xin-yi.name: Amberly Pock Xin Yi
amberly-pock-xin-yi.writeup:
Hi! I'm Amberly, a Year 2 Environmental and Sustainability Engineering Student with a second major in Sustainable Urban Development, and I live at Residential College 4! I chose Environmental and Sustainability Engineering as I'm passionate about sustainability and want to learn how to create or improve on solutions that makes the world a better place to live in, for both present and future generations. Areas I'm particularly interested in are renewable energy, and circular economy.

Currently, I'm actively participating in NUS CCAs such as d'Hoppers, SAVE and Project OceaNUS. In my time at NUS, I hope to take up various research opportunities and internships to put what I've learnt to practical use, and embark on projects that can help the environment and those around me!

hannah-hoo.name: Hannah Hoo
hannah-hoo.writeup: Hello! My name is Hannah and I'm a Y2 Environmental and Sustainability Engineering student, with a second major in Sustainable Urban Development. I am currently staying at College of Alice and Peter Tan. Feel free to find me to chat about anything!

ong-choon-heng.name: Ong Choon Heng
ong-choon-heng.writeup:
Hi! I am Choon Heng, currently studying Industrial System Engineering under the E-Scholars Programme. I am staying in U-Town at Residential College 4.

I hope to be able to delve deeper into my major with a specialisation in Supply Chain Analytics, while also meeting new people along the way.

Beyond academics, I also enjoy travelling to overseas and eating good food!

teo-jun-jie-jeremy.name: Teo Jun Jie Jeremy
teo-jun-jie-jeremy.writeup: Hello! I am Jeremy and I am currently majoring in ISE.
teo-jun-jie-jeremy.interests_hobbies:
Loves playing sports like Floorball and Ultimate Frisbee!
Enjoys music and playing musical instruments

hazel-yeo.name: Hazel Yeo
hazel-yeo.writeup:
Hello! My name is Hazel Yeo and I am a Y2 Materials Science and Engineering (MSE) student living in RC4. I chose MSE as this major marries my interests in both physics and chemistry.

During my study at NUS, I hope to go on exchange under the Student Exchange Programme (SEP) to broaden my world view and equip myself with essential interpersonal skills.

In my free time, I like to try out new food places and cycle around Singapore! I also enjoy volunteering at nearby community centres and interacting with my immediate community.

kayla-khoo-khia-hsuen.name: Kayla Khoo Khia Hsuen
kayla-khoo-khia-hsuen.writeup:
Hello!! My name is Kayla Khoo and I am a Y2 Materials Science and Engineering student under the Engineering Scholars Programme. I am currently staying at CAPT!

I am currently planning on taking a second major in Innovation & Design. For my major, I do not have any specific area of interest yet but hope to discover one soon further into the academic year!

Outside of academics, I enjoy dancing (different genres of dance!) and performing together with my friends! I also like to destress through art and crafts during my free time and going for walks outside. :)
kayla-khoo-khia-hsuen.notable_achievements:
Designed my cohort‚Äôs graduation banner in secondary school
Performed during the National Day Parade 2023
Learnt how to do digital 3D sculpting on my own
kayla-khoo-khia-hsuen.interests_hobbies:
Dancing
Art and crafts
Listening to music

chin-yi-en.name: Chin Yi En
chin-yi-en.writeup:
Hi! I‚Äôm Yi En, a Year 2 Materials Science and Engineering student under the E-scholars programme.
I‚Äôm still unsure of what specialisation/ 2nd major I would want to take but I‚Äôm thinking of doing a second major/minor in IDP.
I‚Äôm hoping to go for the Semester Exchange Programme (SEP) to experience studying overseas, though I‚Äôve yet to decide on the location.
Looking forward to the experiences and  opportunities ahead!

bryan-chua.name: Bryan Chua
bryan-chua.writeup:
Hi! I am Bryan, a Mechanical Engineering student under the E-Scholars Programme. I am also currently a resident in College of Alice and Peter Tan. During my studies in NUS, I am interested in pursuing a minor in entrepreneurship, as well as joining a NOC programme. Outside of my academics, I am excited to explore some of my interests, such as picking up tennis and learning how to bake!

I am thrilled to be part of the E-Scholars community and I believe the academic rigour of the programme, as well as the opportunities it presents will allow me to realize my full potential and discover more about myself along the way!

jonathan-chew.name: Jonathan Chew
jonathan-chew.writeup:
I an Jonathan! I am a Y2 mech eng student under the E-scholars programme and I‚Äôm currently in Tembusu.
I‚Äôm planning to a double major in computing!

joshua-er.name: Joshua Er
joshua-er.writeup: Hi Im Josh doing Mechanical Engineering. I have lived overseas for 13 years of my life studying in Shanghai. When I came back to Singapore I finished IB in Tanglin Trust School before proceeding to national service. Besides academics, I do occasionally enjoy running and exploring new areas so if you ever have a good route, feel free to contact me.

ngan-ka-fye.name: Ngan Ka Fye
ngan-ka-fye.writeup:
Hello! I‚Äôm Dean, a Mechanical Engineering major minoring in Psychology.

Wait, Engineering and Psychology? Yes, I take an interest in a broad range of subjects, and I am fortunate to be able to further my intellectual development with NUS College.

I love keeping active in my free time, whether it be swimming, cycling, running, climbing, hiking, badminton, table tennis‚Ä¶ yeah I really do have many interests.
ngan-ka-fye.notable_achievements:
‚Ä¢ Slept at least 8 hours a day on average throughout secondary school.
‚Ä¢ Slept at least 7 hours a day on average throughout junior college.
‚Ä¢ Currently sleep debt-free.

kae-lim.name: Kae Lim
kae-lim.writeup: I'm doing Mechanical Engineering but I also have interests in material science, chemistry and linguistics. I enjoy working with my hands, including woodcarving, building furniture and legos.

laura-lee.name: Laura Lee
laura-lee.writeup:
As an Engineering Scholar specializing in Mechanical Engineering with a focus on Energy and Sustainability, I am committed to addressing global challenges, particularly those related to climate change and environmental sustainability. I aspire to attain the skills and knowledge necessary to innovate and develop transformative solutions in the energy sector.

With a deep passion for mathematics, physics, and engineering, I am driven to apply my expertise to create sustainable technologies that contribute to a better future. My approach combines analytical rigor with a commitment to social responsibility, recognizing the importance of leveraging my opportunities to effect positive change.

I am dedicated to continuous learning and collaboration, believing that true innovation arises from the intersection of diverse ideas and perspectives. Through my work, I aim to contribute meaningfully to the development of sustainable solutions that will shape a resilient and equitable world for future generations.

loh-ming-cheng.name: Loh Ming Cheng
loh-ming-cheng.writeup: Hello! I am ming cheng, staying at tembusu college. I am studying Mechanical Engineering, hoping to do a second major in computer science too!
loh-ming-cheng.interests_hobbies: Sports, Playing board games and Nature!

mao-ruijie.name: Mao Ruijie
mao-ruijie.writeup:
Hi! I'm Ruijie, Mechanical Engineering undergraduate in NUS. I am grateful to be part of the Engineering Scholars Programme and its community of passionate individuals.

I constantly seek to learn and gain a deeper understanding of the world around me, from the socio-political dynamics of society to the physics of the universe. At the moment, I aim to pursue computing in conjunction with engineering to better leverage the strengths of our digital systems as a tool to understand the physical world. Examples include computational fluid dynamics, finite element analysis, and computational astrophysics (and numerical relativity).

I am also invested in a wide array of hobbies in my free time, such as photography, graphic design, video editing, and playing the piano. Though, I am completely self-taught in all these areas.

If you have any questions about me, feel free to contact me!
mao-ruijie.notable_achievements:
Student Leader of the Year 2021 (River Valley High School)
Chinese Calligraphy National Youth Competition Champion

tan-ser-gi-chloe.name: Tan Ser Gi Chloe
tan-ser-gi-chloe.writeup: Hello I am chloe. I study Mechanical Engineering under the e scholars program. I reside in RC4 and im from Noctua. My academic plan as of now is to have an aeronautical engineering specialisation, and hopefully, to be able to complete a second major in economics. I hope to be able to go for a student exchange program (SEP) in Finland, to experience what it is like to live and study in the world‚Äôs happiest country! Apart from academics, i find joy in road cycling, and I hope to be able to cycle from Singapore to China one day. I also enjoy playing weiqi, as it allows me to meet many different people from all walks of lives.
tan-ser-gi-chloe.notable_achievements:
2022-2023 Deans list.
China ASEAN board and card games international invitational tournament 2019.

lim-wei-en-wayne.name: Lim Wei En, Wayne
lim-wei-en-wayne.writeup: I am someone who is not very ambitious, but wishes to complete his degree in 3 years as well as a Masters by the fourth year. Being someone who over-committed himself to leadership positions in JC and secondary school, I wish to use university to pace myself, and understand more about the field I am going into, rather than dive into student life planning and coordination. Apart from academics, I wish to participate in dance, badminton and volleyball on the RC level, inter-RC and inter-house level games as well as fly drone.
lim-wei-en-wayne.notable_achievements:
EAGLES award (2021)
NPCC Long Service Award (2021)
6th in Army Intelligence Officer Cadet Course (2022)
lim-wei-en-wayne.interests_hobbies:
Playing sports
Dancing
Listening to music

luo-xin-yue.name: Luo Xin Yue
luo-xin-yue.writeup: Hi, I'm Xin Yue. SCGS and RI alumnus. I go with the flow and idk what I'm doing half the time. You can't control what life throws at you most of the time so I don't worry about it too much.
luo-xin-yue.notable_achievements:
ESIS recipient (2022-2023)
getting the E-scholars scholarship

lee-yu-wei-ryan.name: Lee Yu Wei, Ryan
lee-yu-wei-ryan.writeup: I'm Ryan, an aspiring engineer looking to make a difference in the things I do. I'm constantly broadening my horizons, learning and experiencing new things every day and finding opportunities to put my knowledge to the test. Although I work hard, I also take the time to engage in a wide range of hobbies, keeping my mind refreshed yet active.
lee-yu-wei-ryan.notable_achievements: Research paper on Feasibility of Superman Memory

claire-ng.name: Claire Ng
claire-ng.writeup:
Hello! My name is Claire and I‚Äôm a Y2 industrial design student, but I‚Äôm also an artist who does illustration. I love designs that are not only practical but also fun, lively and bold! I hope to learn how to marry the functional and minimal aspects of industrial design with the expressive dynamics of illustration throughout my years in university.

As a part of the first batch of D-scholars, I am determined to do my best, not only for myself but also to establish a good foundation for future D-scholars.
claire-ng.notable_achievements: SYF 2022 Art Exhibition - certificate of recognition
claire-ng.interests_hobbies:
Illustration and animation
Watching movies and shows
Eating good food

leong-zi-shuen.name: Leong Zi Shuen
leong-zi-shuen.writeup: I'm Zi Shuen and I'm an Industrial Design student under the D-Scholars Programme! I'm looking forward to pursuing a specialization in service design, but I'm excited to try everything else too! Backed by my interest in human behaviour, I aspire to dabble in human-centred solutions.
